explanation: No additional symbols are required. The target function try_ready_normal_body contains no for statements, so there are no for-loop clauses to inspect for MISRA well‑formedness. The MISRA rule concerns the three clauses of for statements and also the behaviour of functions called from within a for loop body; because try_ready_normal_body does not contain any for loops, there is nothing in this function that can violate that specific rule. (If a later analysis were to inspect a for loop that called any of the functions invoked here, then the callee symbols listed in the static call graph — e.g. MHD_connection_alloc_memory_, connection_close_error, MHD_connection_close_, and any transitive callees — would need to be examined to determine whether their behaviour within that for loop body introduces side effects that break the rule.)
